intro: Hitzera edulis, commonly known as the edible hitzera, is a shrub native to arid regions of Africa. It belongs to the family Cucurbitaceae, which includes cucumbers and gourds. The plant produces small, fleshy fruits that are rich in nutrients and used in local cuisines. Its leaves are also edible and often consumed as a vegetable. Hitzera edulis is adapted to survive in harsh environments, making it an important food source in dry areas.
